Author: alexvilis
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Pavo Teams with TAKE Energy Corporation of Japan  Agreement provides for deployment of Pavo IoT Blockchain agriculture solution in Japan, co-development of online marketplace  SAN FRANCISCO, CA, September 21, 2018âââPavo, a software company providing a fee-based IoT Blockchain software platform for the agriculture ecosystem, announced today a partnership with TAKE Energy Corporation of Japan, which will see the deployment of Pavoâs solution in Japan.  Already deployed in Turkey and California, Pavoâs IoT Blockchain software platform has demonstrated its ability to increase hazelnut yields by as much as 30 percent.  TAKE Energy Corporation manages, designs and builds electrical power plants, including solar power plants, in Japan. The company possesses special know-how in navigating the process of procuring construction contracts and financing while clearing various regulatory restrictions, to provide clean, sustainable, electrical power.  The agreement signed between Pavo and TAKE also provides for joint development of Pavoâs online marketplace and digital cryptocurrency settlement process within TAKEâs jurisdiction.  Remarking on the agreement, Erhan Cakmak, co-founder and CEO of Pavo said âWe are delighted to partner with TAKE to develop the Japanese market, as we continue work on our plans to expand geographically and execute on our growth plan, expanding our reach in a global ecosystem which demands sustainable, traceable, food on their table from known sources.â  The partnership falls under the domain of TAKEâs pre-existing initiatives in water and energy conservation in the Japanese agricultural sector in the Kumamoto prefecture.  âTEC brings regional expertise that helps deliver Pavoâs highly evaluated solution to the customers in Japan,â said by TEC Founder and CEO Kazuma Takemoto. âWe welcome Pavo as a partner and their ability to expand the reach of Pavo solution capabilities throughout Japan.â https://medium.com/@PavoIoT/pavo-teams-with-take-energy-corporation-of-japan-fc3aab57f012

Author: S3cco
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Bitcoin Garden: Blockchain Can Solve Supply Chain Problems in Agriculture https://bitcoingarden.org/blockchain-can-solve-supply-chain-problems-in-agriculture/  Experienced entrepreneur and investor Nick Evdokimov recently shared his interest in the relationship between the agriculture and blockchain technology. In an online course on YouTube, the expert focused on how some applications could benefit the industry by bringing a new level of efficiency to their markets. Nick believes there is one particular startup, Pavo, that can bring fresh solutions by allowing farmers to sell futures of their products.  It shouldnât come as a surprise that agriculture is a $5 trillion industry that employs over a billion people around the world. However, it can be a thankless business for some of its most important value creators. In the agriculture supply chain, farmers and growers are generally left in the position of price takers, not price setters. This is due to many complex economic factors ranging from economies of scale to general inefficiencies in supply and demand.  A simple to understand fact is that the results of a farmerâs output are generally seen months after the first seed is planted. Given the situation, a farmer always works to provide an uncertain supply to an uncertain demand....

Author: ThachSanhTp
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Food safetyâs great, but what about food prices? Theyâre constantly rising. Blockchain could eliminate paper-based processes and cut costs, with these savings passed on to you.  Getting rid of middlemen would minimize transaction fees, and decentralization would also make it easier for smaller farms to compete with larger corporations. For example, blockchain concepts such as PavoCoin are entering the fray â giving smaller farmers access to attainable financial services, such as the ability to pre-sell crops via smart contracts, helping them to improve the quality and quantity of their harvests, and providing consumers with greater amounts of information about the food they are buying. The company says, farmers in Stockton and in Dixon, California, have recently started using the system. A third installation is planned in Merced soon.  Optimizing farming would empower farmers of all scales with the information, resources and security they need to have higher yields, more lucrative crops. This would drive prices down for the average consumer and increase accessibility to higher quality goods. Higher yields also pump more money into the agricultural ecosystem, increasing the availability of farmed goods.

Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: While the majority of us simply consider nuts to be an extremely good source of protein, and tasty at that, they can play a key role in the economies of some countries. However, the agricultural expertise used to grow such crops tends to be rudimentary, resulting in mismanagement and other inefficiencies.  Pavocoin AG, the provider of an IoT blockchain solution for the AgTech ecosystem, is working to remedy this situation.

Author: JChemist
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Warning -- look at the AgTech ICO ad and look at the KYC Legal ICO Ad https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2370568.0.  The CEO, Allan Young, was also part of the KYC Legal project.  Closed KYC Legal  ICO on April 1 2018; lights turned out July 2, 2018.   Click on the Telegram link for KYC Legal and it returns word scam.  Go to KYC Legal webpage and look for social media links.  They are gone.  But you can find Mr. Young's name on the earliest of advertisements for KYC Legal.   During the time he was an advisor, days after the ICO closed, he did not tell anybody the chief business officer had quit.  Nor did explain any other the other actions.   20+ Million dollars were burned in 2 months or this was a scam.  Even as just a human being in this group, you give a friendly.  Much more is expected if you put your face on an ICO from investors.  At the very least a written statement.  If you invest in AgTech, perhaps it is legit, you should get an answer why Allan Young said nothing when KYC Legal turned off the lights.  He had a duty to investors if he represented the company, even only to glorify his resume with his name and resume on another ICO.   People make mistakes but people also do the right thing.   In this case, there is no evidence at all that Mr. Young did anything as simple as provide a response to investors left high and dry.  Do you really want to invest with someone with this track record.    I  am only suggesting this guy has red flags in terms of credibility for a recent ICO and you due diligence should be to ask hard questions.   Ask them what their duties are and their promises to investors.   They are selling securities and should provide you the basic info like addresses, transparency, is their a partial refund of remaining funds if the ICO goes bust.  And get it in writing.  Make sure you download the white paper and save it.   Make sure the white paper tells you exactly what they are going to do with your money and what they will do to give tokens.   It should include project milestones.  Get the mailing address of the company.  Good Luck

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Hello! We have only one similarity, we work in agricultural sector. Nagricoin's business model is selling their fertilizers. The Pavo IoT Platform is a hybrid software and hardware solution that is easily accessible  through user-friendly desktop, tablet and mobile interfaces. Our goal is an increasing crop yield and quality. Farmers and users subscribe to the platform with a monthly fee (SaaS susbscription). We develop software for agricultural sector. It includes software for sensors and our internal payment system. Pavoâs blockchain-based cryptocurrency will provide a secure payment vehicle throughout the whole ecosystem. There wonât be any need to use fiat money at any step, which will help to prevent fraud, increase transparency, and simplify interactions between ecosystem participants.

Author: brother3
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: In this part Erhan Cakmak, CEO & Co-founder of Pavo focus on the details of ICO..  Farmers are eager to adopt new farming techniques, and many are willing to implement new innovations in AgTech to help them meet demand. Fortunately, the outlook for contemporary farming practices has just improved, as Pavo, the IoT blockchain solution for the AgTech ecosystem, accelerates the roll-out their technology on farms in the US. Pavoâs blockchain-enabled solution was developed to help growers optimize their planting, growing, and harvesting strategies to improve overall crop quality and yield. https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=5&v=DTcwSX15CoU

Author: NightDream
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: How Turkeyâs Hazelnuts Helped Pavo Create the Technology That Will Drive the Global Agricultural Innovation of Tomorrow.    Turkey holds a special place in the hearts and minds of the founders and developers of Pavocoin AG, provider of an IoT blockchain solution for the AgTech ecosystem, with offices in Zug, Switzerland, and San Francisco, California. There is a special connection between the almond and walnut farms and farmers of the California Central Valley, and the hazelnut and almond farms and farmers of Turkey.  As Pavoâs groundbreaking technology is now being rolled out around the world, they aim to apply what they learned from working with Turkish hazelnut farmers and California almond farmers to unite traditional farm practices with the latest in AI, blockchain technology, and analytical science. The company believes that, coupled with the traditional wisdom of local farmers, their innovative IoT and blockchain platform will play a leading role in helping the entire agricultural sector meet the growing demands of an increasing global population.  Hazelnuts are an important crop for the Turkish economy, accounting for 75% of the world market in 2016 according to recent data. Agriculture itself plays a significant role in the Turkish economy overall, making up over 6% of their GDP, while 20% of the countryâs working population is employed in the agricultural sector. Itâs a USD 52 billion industry that has grown 40% from 2002 to 2016. In 2014, extreme weather ravaged the hazelnut crop, however, leading to a 60% price increase in world hazelnut prices. A crop failure of that magnitude can have devastating effects on an economy like Turkeyâs, and smaller growers and producers were particularly hard hit. Pavocoin has developed a system that could help farmers of any scale track and analyze every step of the growing process, from seed to harvest to delivery, in a quest to predict and adjust for local growing conditions.  The company accomplishes this by analyzing present-day conditions along with 10-year data tracking, which they argue offers more accurate predictive models than using simple retrospective analysis alone. Pavocoin Co-Founder and Vice-Chairman Allan Young explains, âBy bringing the cutting-edge technologies of IoT and blockchain, as well as Pavoâs vast experience in crop cultivation, to Turkey, Pavo is fostering an agricultural ecosystem focused on highly technologized crop growing, processing and distribution.â  Young adds, âOur platform tracks the information and uses it to optimize the whole growing cycle by ensuring that vital crop measurements stay within optimal ranges. Our data scientists have done predictive modeling that shows significant yield increases can be achieved, regardless of crop, through the implementation of Pavo.â  Indeed, Pavoâs data scientists have constructed a yield estimator for Turkish farmers that can predict outcomes for each individual hazelnut tree in a given zone. The companyâs preliminary results indicate that their system has the capability to use existing environmental conditions to extract estimates of crop outcomes. The technology is being designed to be a complete system that can be implemented by a farmer of any size. This is crucial in an economy like Turkeyâs agricultural sector, where smaller farmers need to have access to vital new technologies so they can stay competitive in a globalized market.  Pavoâs web- and mobile-driven platform brings together everything the AgTech ecosystem needs, including remote recording, reporting, and analysis of all growing activities from planting to spraying records to shipping conditions and delivery. Everything is tracked, can be analyzed on the fly, and adjustments can be made as needed by the grower. The blockchain component of their system enables secure transactions and payments, smart contracts, and cashless transactions, and itâs all done from one user-friendly platform.  The company has just recently concluded phase one of the public presale of their PAVO ICO. The utility token is what drives the various functionalities of the platform. Phase two of their presale is now active and offers a 33% bonus until August 6, when their main sale will begin. The main sale will continue until September 15, 2018, with various decreasing bonuses offered throughout. https://medium.com/@PavoIoT/how-turkeys-hazelnuts-helped-pavo-create-the-technology-that-will-drive-the-global-agricultural-8c049cdde9be

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Our team includes 12 professional members with years of experience, including: â Allan Young, Pavoâs Co-Founder and Vice-Chairman, founder of a successful startup incubator with years of experience in venture investments. â Erhan Cakmak, Pavoâs CEO and Co-Founder, has more than 25 years of executive management experience. He successfully developed several businesses from scratch into multimillion dollar companies. â Ari Gorman, Pavoâs CTO, brings more than 20 yearsâ experience in telecommunications and related fields. Also the co-founder of Novatel Networks, he has spent the past 16 years building the company through organic growth and acquisitions. â Dave Dabbah, Pavoâs CMO, is a marketing, operations and business executive with over 15 yearsâ experience working with both startups and public companies in B2B and B2C markets. â Atakan Cetinsoy, Pavoâs VP of Product Management, has 20+ years of hi-tech product management and product marketing experience with both global brands and VC-funded startups including Apple, Yahoo!, FedEx, Strands and Deem. Throughout his career, he has repeatedly conceived, launched, and successfully commercialized software products in SaaS software, machine learning, B2B travel, fintech and digital media verticals by leading motivated, customer-focused teams. â David Howard, Pavoâs VP of Corporate Strategy, has 20 years of Silicon Valley marketing experience, in hardware, software and SaaS, including with companies such as Alcatel, Cisco Systems, Platfora, and Salesforce. â Basir Momand, Pavoâs IT & Sensor Engineer, has 30 years of experience in IT, Software Development, VoIP and Infrastructure Planning. Moreover, he was CTO of Alliance Financial after serving as the Director of Customer Service/Infrastructures for Global Investment Group. â Mike Kwan, VP Business Development, has has 18 years of sales leadership and business development experience in digital marketing, enterprise software, SaaS, and transportation. He has been a part of 3 successful acquisitions during his time with Overture, Zipcar and Flywheel Software. â Bill Banks has 25 years of senior management, consulting, and entrepreneurial experience across a range of financial technology, data, software, and financial services firms, with a diverse background in finance, investments, wealth management, business strategy, and operations.

Author: dimasic
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Well, so may you describe me the whole process of token buying?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: You need to register on our platform, where you can participate in the TGE and its stages, deposit funds, buy PAVO tokens, and find all the necessary information. Next, you need to replenish the deposit on your account and undergo KYC procedures for the withdrawal of your tokens. You will be able to withdraw your tokens to a third-party wallet only after the end of the TGE.  After purchasing the tokens, you will be able to bring them to your ETH wallet (it should be your personal wallet, exchange wallets can't be used). When you pay with cryptocurrencies, a commission fee (transaction fee) is charged by the infrastructure of the corresponding block, the size of which you set yourself, and the transaction speed depends on the congestion of the network and the amount of the commission fee that you set.

Author: colennov
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: How big is the hemp market?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: The size of the hemp industry today is approximately USD 650 million. According to the Hemp Business Journal, by 2020 it will be USD 1.8 billion. Some estimate that the global market for hemp consists of more than 25,000 products in nine submarkets: agriculture; textiles; recycling; automotive; furniture; food, nutrition, and beverages; paper; construction materials; and personal care. Pavo can also be used by participants in the industrial hemp arena, and we intend to serve that market as well.

Author: hanskydima
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: How do you improve the harvest?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: There are 16 elements that must be controlled to achieve the yield of a high-quality crop, including: 1.Create a controlled photosynthetic process (atmosphere, lighting levels, humidity) 2.Use âmacroâ nutrients to fertilize the crops (nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium) 3.Secondary nutrients are also needed - calcium, magnesium, and sulfur 4.Use of micronutrients (boron, chlorine, copper, iron, manganese, molybdenum, and zinc) 5.Essential elements - carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen.

Author: IGTcompany
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Hellow What is the main activity of your company? How will blockchain be applied in your product? Thanks

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Hello!  Pavo is a fee-based software platform for the agricultural ecosystem, aimed at increasing crop yield and quality. Pavocoin is an Ethereum token for the entire ecosystem - including distributors, growers, wholesalers, dispensaries, infused product manufacturers, and others - which can be used for secure, safe, reliable payment. Pavoâs initial strategic vertical is the legal cannabis market. Now we are going to work on the whole AgTech sector  Blockchain makes cannabis supply chains more transparent: -consumers know where their product comes from; -growers and distributors are sure that they will receive payment for the delivery; -blockchain solutions can underpin consumer confidence by facilitating transparency and traceability, while still allowing growers to maintain profit margins and trade secrets.

Author: anigmaman
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: How can I buy your tokens?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: You need to register on our platform, where you can participate in the TGE and its stages, deposit funds, buy PAVO tokens, and find all the necessary information. Next, you need to replenish the deposit on your account and undergo KYC procedures for the withdrawal of your tokens. You will be able to withdraw your tokens to a third-party wallet only after the end of the TGE. Payment methods include several cryptocurrencies (BTC, BCH, ETH, LTC, DASH, ZEC) and USD, EUR, CHF. After purchasing the tokens, you will be able to bring them to your ETH wallet (it should be your personal wallet, exchange wallets can't be used)

Author: anigmaman
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: What is payment processing time? and the fees?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: When you pay with cryptocurrencies, a commission fee (transaction fee) is charged by the infrastructure of the corresponding block, the size of which you set yourself, and the transaction speed depends on the congestion of the network and the amount of the commission fee that you set.

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Blockchain allows consumers to know where their product comes from, guarantees growers and distributors that they will receive payment for the delivery. Also, blockchain solutions can underpin consumer confidence by facilitating transparency and traceability, while still allowing growers to maintain profit margins and trade secrets.

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Blockchain are global, transparent, secure ledgers that are ideally suited for storing data that is valuable to many different collaborative and potentially competitive parties. Consequently, blockchains present immutable ledgers that anyone in the world can view and everyone can verify. They are perfectly suited for creating and codifying agreements â smart contracts â between members of the agriculture market, and first and foremost the cannabis ecosystem. Blockchain technology enables the creation of smart contracts for pricing and trading future crops, as is currently done with other commodities like wheat, corn and oil. Of course, derivative products, such as options on futures contracts, are possible and likely, further expanding this financial market. Given that a grow operation may produce as many as five crops per year, we anticipate a large potential for trading activity.

Author: solomen11
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Is your platform made only for cannabis industry?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: We will work with agriculture broadly. Cannabis is just one crop, and from a horticulture perspective, it is like most other crops. Indoor cannabis is directly adjacent to indoor farming for other produce crops, like lettuce, spinach, strawberries. We also have deployments planned, and underway, with tree nut orchards (walnuts, almonds.)

Author: copier
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: What is the difference between you and Pot Coin?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Pot Coin is narrowly focused on the cannabis industry. Pavo is broadly focused on agriculture, across all crops. The main difference between PAVO and Pot Coin is that our project is based on a high-tech, high-quality product. Pavo provides an intelligent state-of-the-art IoT blockchain platform for industry participants to manage their business from seed to consumption. For example, Pavo enables growers to make smarter, faster agricultural and business decisions based on real data.

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: If we are talking about existing competitors:  CannabisCoin had a goal: making transactions easier for medical marijuana dispensaries. Their proposal was to provide a super simple exchange factor from cryptocurrency to actual marijuana for specific strains of marijuana and cannabis preparations. For example, you can exchange CANN at a rate of 1 coin for 1 gram. They are a leader in the cannabis industry, but so far there are no specific expansion plans on the company's website. The difference is that PAVO not only allows quick, secure digital payments between all members of the community, it has also developed an IoT platform that helps growers to improve the quality of cannabis and to reduce production costs. There are a number of companies in the cannabis industry that play around the edges of what we do, for example, Paragon, but no other company provides a platform to manage cannabis growth and distribution from âseed to smoke.â Pavoâs cloud-computing based platform and leading edge IoT technology enable real-time management of gardens, ensuring the highest yield of the highest quality product, while ensuring regulatory compliance, sustainable business practices, and honest, fair play within the cannabis ecosystem. Pavo also provides a private cryptocurrency specifically for the cannabis industry, to alleviate the dangers of dealing in cash. The PAVO coin is a secure, reliable, safe payment instrument The main difference between PAVO and Pot Coin is that our project is based on a high-tech, high-quality product. Pavo provides an intelligent state-of-the-art IoT blockchain platform for industry participants to manage their business from seed to consumption. For example, Pavo enables growers to make smarter, faster agricultural and business decisions based on real data.  But no solution for whole agricultural ecosystem is in development yet, as far as our analytics has researched the market (deep enough )

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: You need to register on our platform, where you can participate in the TGE and its stages, deposit funds, buy PAVO tokens, and find all the necessary information. Next, you need to replenish the deposit on your account and undergo KYC procedures for the withdrawal of your tokens. You will be able to withdraw your tokens to a third-party wallet only after the end of the TGE. Payment methods include several cryptocurrencies (BTC, BCH, ETH, LTC, DASH, ZEC) and USD, EUR, CHF. After purchasing the tokens, you will be able to bring them to your ETH wallet (it should be your personal wallet, exchange wallets can't be used). When you pay with cryptocurrencies, a commission fee (transaction fee) is charged by the infrastructure of the corresponding block, the size of which you set yourself, and the transaction speed depends on the congestion of the network and the amount of the commission fee that you set.

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: CannabisCoin had a goal: making transactions easier for medical marijuana dispensaries. Their proposal was to provide a super simple exchange factor from cryptocurrency to actual marijuana for specific strains of marijuana and cannabis preparations. For example, you can exchange CANN at a rate of 1 coin for 1 gram. They are a leader in the cannabis industry, but so far there are no specific expansion plans on the company's website. The difference is that PAVO not only allows quick, secure digital payments between all members of the community, it has also developed an IoT platform that helps growers to improve the quality of cannabis and to reduce production costs.

Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem

Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Our key developers are following  Team: Ari Gorman, CTO: https://www.linkedin.com/in/ari-gorman-31027513/ Ari has more than 20 years of experience in telecommunications and has held CTO and leadership positions at technology companies with a focus on voice- and video-over-IP network and application delivery. Prior to joining Pavo, Ari was a co-founder and CTO of NovaTel Networks, where he spent the past 16 years. Ari was responsible for network and software planning, design, development, deployment, integration and management of the NovaTel network and infrastructure. Ariâs expertise earned him and NovaTel recognition, evidenced in the multiple collaborations and partnerships with other industry leaders.  Basir Momand, IT & Sensor engineering: https://www.linkedin.com/in/basir-momand-4518a913/    Basir has been involved in software development, VoIP and infrastructure planning, call center technology, IT and tech support for 30 years. Before Pavo, he served as call center general manager and IT and support infrastructure director of CallSocket LP. Basir was the CTO at Alliance Financial, after serving as the director of customer service for the Global Investment Group. He also led the senior technical worldwide support engineer/telecommunications team at Siemens-Munich and at Aspect. Basir has a B.S. in computer science from San Jose State University.  Advisors: Mehmet Coka,Founder at Agrotics, Agriculture Expert: https://www.linkedin.com/in/mehmet-coka-53353a1b/   Mehmet Coka is the founder of Agrotics, Inc. an IoT and analytics platform for the agriculture industry. At Agrotics, Mehmet is responsible for the implementation and development of the IoT platform, the application, and the agricultural development for maximizing crop quality and operational efficiency  Ekrem Buyukkaya, Developer & Designer: https://www.linkedin.com/in/ekrembk/    Born a developer. Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: There are 16 elements that must be controlled to achieve the yield of a high-quality crop, including: 1.Create a controlled photosynthetic process (atmosphere, lighting levels, humidity) 2.Use âmacroâ nutrients to fertilize the crops (nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium) 3.Secondary nutrients are also needed - calcium, magnesium, and sulfur 4.Use of micronutrients (boron, chlorine, copper, iron, manganese, molybdenum, and zinc) 5.Essential elements - carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen.

To support the development of the Pavo community, the PAVO Foundation will reward the Pavo ecosystem's partners with a regular distribution of tokens through its Partner Rewards Program. In turn, each partner can motivate contributors to action by distributing rewards to participants in its own app or platform. This will support the growth of the Pavo network by driving users to receive, buy, use, and hold PAVO. Further, the Foundation will issue grants to help bootstrap the coin's financial utility for early contributors.

Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: This is very unlikely to happen for the following reasons. From the economic point of view, everything speaks in favor of our project succeeding. The vast growth of the market, experience of the team, and federal legalization are signaling a promising future. But what is most important when speaking about the possibility of an acquisition, is our personal connection with this project. We have dedicated ourselves to it. Most of the team members have personal motivation to succeed in this very important mission - making the cannabis industry transparent, eco-friendly, and simple. We chose this industry to make the world a better place, so we have no intention now or in the future to sell. We love what we do and have no desire to stop doing it

With computer-based knowledge and data-driven analysis, our software makes production of every specific species of plant easy and profitable. Due to differentials in varietals and strains of cannabis it is actually impossible to find generic solution to growing plants, making customization a necessity which we successfully satisfy.

Author: vi.vir
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: What is the difference between you and CANN?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: CannabisCoin had a goal: making transactions easier for medical marijuana dispensaries. Their proposal was to provide a super simple exchange factor from cryptocurrency to actual marijuana for specific strains of marijuana and cannabis preparations. For example, you can exchange CANN at a rate of 1 coin for 1 gram. They are a leader in the cannabis industry, but so far there are no specific expansion plans on the company's website. The difference is that PAVO not only allows quick, secure digital payments between all members of the community, it has also developed an IoT platform that helps growers to improve the quality of cannabis and to reduce production costs.

Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: You need to register on our platform, where you can participate in the TGE and its stages, deposit funds, buy PAVO tokens, and find all the necessary information. Next, you need to replenish the deposit on your account and undergo KYC procedures for the withdrawal of your tokens. You will be able to withdraw your tokens to a third-party wallet only after the end of the TGE. Payment methods include several cryptocurrencies (BTC, ETH, LTC, DASH) and USD. After purchasing the tokens, you will be able to bring them to your ETH wallet (it should be your personal wallet, exchange wallets can't be used). When you pay with cryptocurrencies, a commission fee (transaction fee) is charged by the infrastructure of the corresponding block, the size of which you set yourself, and the transaction speed depends on the congestion of the network and the amount of the commission fee that you set.

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: The token has great growth potential. To support the development of the Pavo community, the PAVO community program will reward the Pavo ecosystemâs partners with a regular distribution of tokens through its Partner Rewards Program. In turn, each partner can motivate contributors to action by distributing rewards to participants in its own app or platform. This will support the growth of the Pavo network by driving users to receive, buy, use, and hold PAVO. Further, the community program will issue grants to help bootstrap the coin's financial utility for early contributors. Also, the founders and team members who own PAVO will be prohibited from liquidating more than 20% of their position within the first calendar year to firmly establish PAVO as a steady, reliable coin. Pavo is not designed for any speculative purposes.

If our token is subject to legal regulation, it is possible that the token price will decrease. However, we will do everything in our power to develop a quality product that will compete with the best brands in the AgTech industry and create continuous value for all. Our goal is to create value for all Pavo customers and increase the value of our Company.

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: We will work with agriculture broadly. Cannabis is just one crop, and from a horticulture perspective, it is like most other crops. Indoor cannabis is directly adjacent to indoor farming for other produce crops, like lettuce, spinach, strawberries. We also have deployments planned, and underway, with tree nut orchards (walnuts, almonds.)

Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: How is blockchain used?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Blockchain makes cannabis supply chains more transparent: -consumers know where their product comes from; -growers and distributors are sure that they will receive payment for the delivery; -blockchain solutions can underpin consumer confidence by facilitating transparency and traceability, while still allowing growers to maintain profit margins and trade secrets.

Author: vicklank
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: And why do you use IoT?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: 1. Cloud computing solutions and Internet of Things technology can help manage electricity consumption. 2. Blockchain-based payment and supply chain solutions can enable growers to better manage costs on supplies. 3. Technology which enables tracking throughout the entire lifecycle of plants allows growers to record all materials related to the plants. 4. Wireless sensors transmit data to cloud storage, where it's processed by Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence algorithms.

Author: zontik232
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: perfect! tell me about data analysis pls. How do you use it?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: The analysis is performed as soon as enough information is gathered in the system over the course of two rolling grow cycles (i.e., approximately 15-18 weeks). Then a list of practical recommendations is drawn up to reduce consumption of power, water, and supplies and undue maintenance costs. Constant monitoring of streams of sensor and operational data also helps Pavo to automatically compute a GrowScore (Automated Corrective Crop Monitoring) per section that is presented in the form of a heatmap.

Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: We ensure high-level safety and security of your property. The protection system involves support for cultivator identification and authorization per zone, automatic and ad-hoc audits, as well as incident alerts for added safety.

Author: ele-van
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: What will happen if your project closes?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: There are only a few factors that can reduce the demand for PavoCoin, leading to the closure of our project. These are: changes in the legal status of the cannabis industry, including political and economic risks, emergence of new players with the same product, and technical failure. None of these are likely to happen for the following reasons. The legal status of cannabis is showing a strong trend toward full legalization for recreational, medical, and industrial use. Given the ongoing political situation in the U.S. and other countries, all the stakeholders in power in the markets which look interesting for us are in favor of full legalization. This trend and its acceleration make the rollback of legalization of the cannabis industry not just improbable, but most surely impossible. As for new players who may try to capture the market in which we work and are planning to expand, our experience, team, and know-how make us not just competitive, but guarantee our leadership in this industry. As for technical failure - the blockchain technology, in association with the Internet of Things, has proved itself to be a safe, faultless, and hack-free system in a number of industries. Governments, gigantic corporations, and intelligent agencies around the globe are implementing this technology into their workflow, ensuring security for themselves

Author: night_stalker
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: How big is the hemp market?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: The size of the hemp industry today is approximately USD 650 million. According to the Hemp Business Journal, by 2020 it will be USD 1.8 billion. Some estimate that the global market for hemp consists of more than 25,000 products in nine submarkets: agriculture; textiles; recycling; automotive; furniture; food, nutrition, and beverages; paper; construction materials; and personal care. Pavo can also be used by participants in the industrial hemp arena, and we intend to serve that market as well.

Author: bra.inst
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: How can I buy your tokens?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: You need to register on our platform, where you can participate in the TGE and its stages, deposit funds, buy PAVO tokens, and find all the necessary information. Next, you need to replenish the deposit on your account and undergo KYC procedures for the withdrawal of your tokens. You will be able to withdraw your tokens to a third-party wallet only after the end of the TGE. Payment methods include several cryptocurrencies (BTC, ETH, LTC, DASH) and USD. After purchasing the tokens, you will be able to bring them to your ETH wallet (it should be your personal wallet, exchange wallets can't be used). When you pay with cryptocurrencies, a commission fee (transaction fee) is charged by the infrastructure of the corresponding block, the size of which you set yourself, and the transaction speed depends on the congestion of the network and the amount of the commission fee that you set.

Author: huram2x
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Tell me about the Cannabis Internet of Things

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: A few examples: 1. Microsoft partnered with a tracking technology to prevent the spread of legally grown cannabis into the black market. 3. PotBotics Inc., Palo Alto, developed wireless solar-powered sensors to collect and stream data on temperature, light, humidity, and soil acidity to the cloud, for subsequent analysis. 4. RFID (radio frequency identification technology) markers allow cannabis plants to be tracked from seed-to-sale, to shut out the black market and to ensure product quality and consistency. 5. Syqe Inhaler is an Internet-connected cannabis dispenser developed in Israel. It's connected to the Internet so doctors can monitor and control dosing.

Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem

Wireless sensors transmit data to cloud storage, where it's processed by Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence algorithms.

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: As of autumn 2017, some 29 states and Washington, D.C. have legalized medical cannabis. On January 1, 2018, cannabis was legalized for recreational use in the following states: Alaska, California, Colorado, District of Columbia, Maine, Massachusetts, Nevada, Oregon, and Washington. The process of legalization will continue.

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Cannabis has recreational and medicinal uses, and hemp fiber has a multitude of industrial uses, including use in clothing, manufacturing, and construction. In recent years, leading brands such as Mercedes, BMW, Burberry, and Armani have added hemp to their products.

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: There are a number of serious problems in the current cannabis industry, which PAVO resolves: 1. The main problem is decreasing prices. This is caused by: -expansion of growing facilities, -increase in both supply and competition. 2. Another important problem is rising utility costs â this is one of the largest problems for growers. 3. Indoor growers encounter long-term problems with landlords (usually due to mistrust). 4. Regulatory oversight under a number of laws severely limited the industry after legalization, leaving market participants struggling to maintain compliance. 5. Huge bills on energy, because it does not enjoy lower per-unit costs with increased volume. 6. Scaling grower operations without an industry-grade IoT platform will be very difficult. Pavo will provide the scalable, trusted, and secure platform and help the Cannabis Industry to prosper and flourish.

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: The value of the token has a great potential. Mainstream users help fund the platform, which in turn drives the demand for and adoption of the cryptocurrency. To support the development of the Pavo community, the PAVO Foundation will reward the Pavo ecosystem's partners with a regular distribution of tokens through its Partner Rewards Program. In turn, each partner can motivate contributors to action by distributing rewards to participants in its own app or platform. This will support the growth of the Pavo network by driving users to receive, buy, use, and hold PAVO. Further, the Foundation will issue grants to help bootstrap the coin's financial utility for early contributors.

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: You need to register on our platform, where you can participate in the TGE and its stages, deposit funds, buy PAVO tokens, and find all the necessary information. Next, you need to replenish the deposit on your account and undergo KYC procedures for the withdrawal of your tokens. You will be able to withdraw your tokens to a third-party wallet only after the end of the TGE. Payment methods include several cryptocurrencies (BTC, ETH, LTC, DASH) and USD. After purchasing the tokens, you will be able to bring them to your ETH wallet (it should be your personal wallet, exchange wallets can't be used). When you pay with cryptocurrencies, a commission fee (transaction fee) is charged by the infrastructure of the corresponding block, the size of which you set yourself, and the transaction speed depends on the congestion of the network and the amount of the commission fee that you set.  Our site: pavocoin.com

Author: TornadoMv
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: What will happen if your project closes?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: There are only a few factors that can reduce the demand for PavoCoin, leading to the closure of our project. These are: changes in the legal status of the cannabis industry, including political and economic risks, emergence of new players with the same product, and technical failure. None of these are likely to happen for the following reasons. The legal status of cannabis is showing a strong trend toward full legalization for recreational, medical, and industrial use. Given the ongoing political situation in the U.S. and other countries, all the stakeholders in power in the markets which look interesting for us are in favor of full legalization. This trend and its acceleration make the rollback of legalization of the cannabis industry not just improbable, but most surely impossible. As for new players who may try to capture the market in which we work and are planning to expand, our experience, team, and know-how make us not just competitive, but guarantee our leadership in this industry. As for technical failure - the blockchain technology, in association with the Internet of Things, has proved itself to be a safe, faultless, and hack-free system in a number of industries. Governments, gigantic corporations, and intelligent agencies around the globe are implementing this technology into their workflow, ensuring security for themselves

Author: TornadoMv
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Could you be purchased by any other project?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: This is very unlikely to happen for the following reasons. From the economic point of view, everything speaks in favor of our project succeeding. The vast growth of the market, experience of the team, and federal legalization are signaling a promising future. But what is most important when speaking about the possibility of an acquisition, is our personal connection with this project. We have dedicated ourselves to it. Most of the team members have personal motivation to succeed in this very important mission - making the cannabis industry transparent, eco-friendly, and simple. We chose this industry to make the world a better place, so we have no intention now or in the future to sell. We love what we do and have no desire to stop doing it.

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem

Body: The funds will be used to fund key activities such as Marketing & Sales (Users), Development (Wallet 2.0 & 3.0), Partnerships (Industry, Technology), and Customer Support (Users). The following is a rough relative distribution: â¢ Reserve: 5% of funds set aside for unforeseen/unpredictable costs. â¢ Legal expenses: 5% of funds planned for lawyers and legal consulting. â¢ Development: 40% of funds allocated for the rollout of the PAVO IoT platform, crypto-exchange maintenance and necessary adjustments. â¢ Community: 30% of funds will be used to expand adoption. This includes the growth and maintenance of our US and international community. â¢ Administration: 10% of the funds are slated for all associated administration costs. â¢ Marketing: 10% of the funds will be directed at PR, social media paid marketing, partnerships, affiliate programs and more.

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: The analysis is performed as soon as enough information is gathered in the system over the course of two rolling grow cycles (i.e., approximately 15-18 weeks). Then a list of practical recommendations is drawn up to reduce consumption of power, water, and supplies and undue maintenance costs. Constant monitoring of streams of sensor and operational data also helps Pavo to automatically compute a GrowScore (Automated Corrective Crop Monitoring) per section that is presented in the form of a heatmap

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: There are few risks relating to US law. Distribution of cannabis to minors, transporting cannabis from states where it is legal to other states, drugged driving and other adverse public health consequences, growing cannabis on public lands, cannabis possession or use on federal property, and other criminal activity or violence associated with the sale of cannabis. It may subject the company to civil or criminal liability and the utility, liquidity, or trading price of PAVO tokens may be adversely affected, or PAVO tokens may cease to be traded.

Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: The size of the hemp industry today is approximately USD 650 million. According to the Hemp Business Journal, by 2020 it will be USD 1.8 billion. Some estimate that the global market for hemp consists of more than 25,000 products in nine submarkets: agriculture; textiles; recycling; automotive; furniture; food, nutrition, and beverages; paper; construction materials; and personal care. Pavo can also be used by participants in the industrial hemp arena, and we intend to serve that market as well.

Author: anigmaman
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: This is very unlikely to happen for the following reasons. From the economic point of view, everything speaks in favor of our project succeeding. The vast growth of the market, experience of the team, and federal legalization are signaling a promising future. But what is most important when speaking about the possibility of an acquisition, is our personal connection with this project. We have dedicated ourselves to it. Most of the team members have personal motivation to succeed in this very important mission - making the cannabis industry transparent, eco-friendly, and simple. We chose this industry to make the world a better place, so we have no intention now or in the future to sell. We love what we do and have no desire to stop doing it

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: CannabisCoin had a goal: making transactions easier for medical marijuana dispensaries. Their proposal was to provide a super simple exchange factor from cryptocurrency to actual marijuana for specific strains of marijuana and cannabis preparations. For example, you can exchange CANN at a rate of 1 coin for 1 gram. They are a leader in the cannabis industry, but so far there are no specific expansion plans on the company's website. The difference is that PAVO not only allows quick, secure digital payments between all members of the community, it has also developed an IoT platform that helps growers to improve the quality of cannabis and to reduce production costs. The advantage over competitors is that we, as an IoT platform, also offer a set of growing equipment that will be connected to the Pavo platform and which can be controlled remotely in real time.

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Hello! PavoCoin (PAVO) is a cryptocurrency payment system. PavoCoin is an Ethereum token that enables cannabis market participants (such as growers, producers, innovators, retailers, and service providers) in our network to accept digital payments from their customers and community members. PAVO is a functional usage coin and an alternative to traditional payment instruments like cash or plastic cards.

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: The main factor that can affect the value of the token is the number of customers. To support the development of the community, the PAVO community program will reward the Pavo ecosystemâs partners with the regular distribution of tokens through its Partner Rewards Program. In turn, each partner can motivate contributors to action by distributing rewards to participants in its own app or platform. This will support the growth of the Pavo network by driving users to receive, buy, use, and hold PAVO. Further, the program will issue grants to help bootstrap the coin's financial utility for early contributors. More information on this issue will appear a little later.

Author: borutotheson
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: What do you aim at creating this platform?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Hello! There are a number of serious problems in the current cannabis industry, which PAVO resolves: 1. The main problem is decreasing prices. This is caused by: -expansion of growing facilities, -increase in both supply and competition. 2. Another important problem is rising utility costs â this is one of the largest problems for growers. 3. Indoor growers encounter long-term problems with landlords (usually due to mistrust). 4. Regulatory oversight under a number of laws severely limited the industry after legalization, leaving market participants struggling to maintain compliance. 5. Huge bills on energy, because it does not enjoy lower per-unit costs with increased volume.

Author: borutotheson
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Do creators see a mission?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Pavo is a fee-based software platform for the agricultural ecosystem, aimed at increasing crop yield and quality. Pavocoin is an Ethereum token for the entire ecosystem - including distributors, growers, wholesalers, dispensaries, infused product manufacturers, and others - which can be used for secure, safe, reliable payment.

Author: vicklank
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: hello. Why did you decide to use blockchain? won't be possible to create your platform without blockchain?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Hi! Blockchain makes cannabis supply chains more transparent: -consumers know where their product comes from; -growers and distributors are sure that they will receive payment for the delivery; -blockchain solutions can underpin consumer confidence by facilitating transparency and traceability, while still allowing growers to maintain profit margins and trade secrets.

Author: zontik232
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: What wallets are fine to your system? can you recommend any?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Hello, you can transfer your tokens to any Ethereum wallet, but it's important to remember that they need to support ERC20. Also, the ETH wallet should be your personal wallet, as exchange wallets (Kraken, Bittrex, Coinbase) can't be used.

Author: anigmaman
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: What is the use of blockchain in your case?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Blockchain allows consumers to know where their product comes from, guarantees growers and distributors that they will receive payment for the delivery. Also blockchain solutions can underpin consumer confidence by facilitating transparency and traceability, while still allowing growers to maintain profit margins and trade secrets.

Author: anigmaman
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: What opportunities does it have?

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Blockchain are global, transparent, secure ledgers that are ideally suited for storing data that is valuable to many different collaborative and potentially competitive parties. Consequently, blockchains present immutable ledgers that anyone in the world can view and everyone can verify. They are perfectly suited for creating and codifying agreements â smart contracts â between members of the agriculture market, and first and foremost the cannabis ecosystem. Blockchain technology enables the creation of smart contracts for pricing and trading future crops, as is currently done with other commodities like wheat, corn and oil. Of course, derivative products, such as options on futures contracts, are possible and likely, further expanding this financial market. Given that a grow operation may produce as many as five crops per year, we anticipate a large potential for trading activity.

Author: vicklank

Body: Iâve read about some plans to create the Foundation?...

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: The founders and the Board of Directors of Pavocoin will be responsible for the efficient use of funds resulting from any sale of tokens from the Pavo reserve. Some elements of the platform will remain centralized until decentralized options become feasible or desirable. The Pavo foundation will be responsible for allocating Partner Rewards to platforms or apps in the ecosystem, creating developer extensions that provide visibility to the use of apps within the ecosystem (such as reporting on and visualization of activity), evangelizing the Pavo ecosystem to innovators, cultivators and app developers and content partners, bringing promising and diverse platforms and apps into the ecosystem, and more. Over time, Pavo will consider moving to a decentralized governance system such as those presented by others in the cryptocurrency community. Through our advisors we are connected to the ICO Governance Foundation, and intend to work with that organization closely

Body: Our platform is fully customizable, matching the unique needs of every grower and every plant they produce. With computer-based knowledge and data-driven analysis, our software makes production of every specific species of plant easy and profitable. Due to differentials in varietals and strains of cannabis it is actually impossible to find generic solution to growing plants, making customization a necessity which we successfully satisfy.

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: The analysis is performed as soon as enough information is gathered in the system over the course of two rolling grow cycles (i.e., approximately 15-18 weeks). Then a list of practical recommendations is drawn up to reduce consumption of power, water, and supplies and undue maintenance costs. Constant monitoring of streams of sensor and operational data also helps Pavo to automatically compute a GrowScore (Automated Corrective Crop Monitoring) per section that is presented in the form of a heatmap.

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: What makes the Pavo platform truly different from other enterprise solutions, such as basic inventory management software, is its focus on marrying applied machine learning with the teamâs decades of experience in agricultural yield management techniques. The Pavo team includes data scientists and executives with direct experience in implementing enterprise-grade predictive anaâytics solutions that turn data into actionable insights.

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Unlike many ICOs, we have a working product with customer deployments.  Pavocoin is a utility token and the first use case is to engage with customers coming on to the platform, putting coins into circulation. Why will they put coins into circulation?  Because it will help farmers.The coin is a utility payment system for the entire agricultural ecosystem and intended to enable new financial services for farmers to decrease costs with a frictionless and cashless transactions. For example, it can shorten the time from crop delivery to payment for farmers, improving their cash flow.  While number of Pavocoin is limited, the potential growth for agriculture production market is unlimited, and in the future years, based on our analysis, this market would only continue growth. That is why constant demand for Pavocoin will result in high trading volume

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Yeah, sure! Blockchain makes cannabis supply chains more transparent: -consumers know where their product comes from; -growers and distributors are sure that they will receive payment for the delivery; -blockchain solutions can underpin consumer confidence by facilitating transparency and traceability, while still allowing growers to maintain profit margins and trade secrets.

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: Hi! Thank you for your question  It isnât just âanyâ killing features - we have a lot of them!  First of all, we are the first company to provide a platform to manage cannabis growth and distribution from âseed to smokeâ. Secondly, Pavoâs cloud-computing based platform and leading edge IoT technology enable real-time management of gardens, ensuring the highest yield of the highest quality product, while ensuring regulatory compliance, sustainable business practices, and honest, fair play within the cannabis ecosystem As for Pavo coin alone - we are not the first to provide a coin for this industry, to take out the pain of dealing in cash, we understand this. But you should be first in order to be the best. We provide quick, secure digital payments between all members of the community with safe and reliable payment method, and it is just a tiny part of our ecosystem.  I hope, now it is clear, why we are aiming on becoming market leaders

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: The PAVO software platform helps growers on any scale and at every step of production. Based on in-depth scientific knowledge of the cannabis plant, our software can provide incremental operational efficiencies for any grower from beginners to industrial players. Our system helps to optimize logistics between growers, suppliers, and distributors using the same platform. We help our clients to find the best and cheapest way to organize their shipments. Our Machine Intelligence system provides such features as crop identification, GrowScore (Automated Corrective Crop Monitoring), Crop Quality Recommendations, Crop Yield Prediction, Predictive Maintenance, Crop Demand Prediction, Lab Test Optimization, Fraud Detection, and Intrusion Detection. Based on the scientific and horticultural expertise of our leadership team, engineers, and advisors, we anticipate that cannabis growers may see yield increases of as much of 30% from using the platform. Pavo will enable smart contracts, possibly including revenue participation contracts, between growers and landlords, providing security and peace of mind for both parties. The rising prices are mostly a result of a lack of trust in growersâ integrity, which will not be a problem once the Pavo platform is in use.

Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: The success of our project does not correlates with prices on the market. We are not a direct intermediator in the agrarian market. Project is aimed at increasing crop yield and quality. However, Pavo IoT provides incremental operational efficiencies for any grower from beginners to industrial players, that brings to decreasing prices and stabilization of agrarian economy.

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: FACEBOOK  TWITTER  INSTAGRAM ã TELEGRAM [EN]  WP  WEBSITE  ANN  ONEPAGER ã TELEGRAM [RU]  LINKEDIN   YOUTUBE    PAVO IoT software platform helps the user: âEasily measure and track the entire cultivation operation from anywhere. âRecord and monitor production practices in real time via the Pavo IoT gateway. âRecord, report, and analyze activities from planting to spray records to shipping. âTrack labor costs and productivity to optimize human resources and related costs.    âThe Pavo IoT platform tracks sensor data and uses it to optimize the entire growing cycle by ensuring that vital crop measurements stay within optimal ranges    â Data about the growing process of each harvest lot will be stored in the blockchain. Pavo will be able to certify the reliability of all information collected from growers    â The Blockchain  powered PAVO agricultural marketplace will allow all participants of the ecosystem conveniently trade quality verified agricultural products using the Pavo coin as a settlement tool. Right now, the IoT software component exists and is deployed at two cannabis grow houses in California, USA.  The PavoCoin (PAVO) is a cryptocurrency payment system that enables agriculture market participants, such as growers, producers, innovators, retailers and service providers in our network to accept digital payments from their customers and community members. PAVO is a functional usage coin. PAVO facilitates transactions among ecosystem participants and serves as an electronic alternative to traditional payment instruments like cash or credit cards. This mitigates both security risks and risks due to a nationally-chartered financial institution shutting down an account. Our mission is to offer a multi-purpose blockchain focusing on value exchange that maximizes the total value for all stakeholders. We are actively developing cutting-edge usage token functionality and wallet features such as recurring payments, proof-of-receipt and exclusive escrow for future exchanges of value provided directly to a PAVO wallet after payment. PavoCoin (PAVO) is a cryptocurrency payment system for agriculture market participants: âGrowers âWholesalers âRetailers âProducers âSuppliers âInnovators âService providers PAVO will provide them all with tools to accept digital payments from their customers and community members.  The Pavocoin token is an ERC-20 token and can be used to: â   Pay the Pavo SaaS subscription (it can also be paid for in fiat currency, but payment in Pavocoin will be rewarded with a discount of up to 10 percent, and sometimes higher, with additional incentives) and in the future, - for other platform fees and payments for services and products â   The only payment method to execute transactions, settlements, and forward contracts between growers, buyers, and other parties through the Pavo platform â   Voting will be used to reward best-in-class applications using the Pavocoin platform, indoor and and indoor growing facilities for outstanding performance within their respective fields (e.g. tree nuts, produce, industrial crops.) Voting will also be used to unlock rewards for community members. â   The only payment method for marketing and advertising services on the platform          Initial price of token is $1   PRE-SALE PHASE               04.27-08.06      $1 + 33% for 2.5k$ purchase MAIN SALE                         08.07-08.18     $1 + 25% bonus                                            08.19-08.25      $1 + 18% bonus                                            08.26-09.01      $1 + 11% bonus                                            09.02-09.08      $1 + 5% bonus                                            09.09-09.15      No Bonus. CLEARING FUNDS PHASE  09.16-09.22 TOKEN DISTRIBUTION      09.23-09.29

Author: tenell
Title: [ANN] [ICO] PAVO - IoT Blockchain for the AgTech Ecosystem
Body: The size of the hemp industry today is approximately USD 650 million. According to the Hemp Business Journal, by 2020 it will be USD 1.8 billion. Some estimate that the global market for hemp consists of more than 25,000 products in nine submarkets: agriculture; textiles; recycling; automotive; furniture; food, nutrition, and beverages; paper; construction materials; and personal care. Pavo can also be used by participants in the industrial hemp arena, and we intend to serve that market as well. Global total agriculture market size â  U.S. $5 trillion Pavo continues to develop smart agriculture deployments with almond farms in California; 80% of the worldâs almond production comes from California. The multi-billion dollar cannabis market is the indoor smart agriculture proving ground for Pavo, where the need of IoT and blockchain-enabled transparency, and a cryptocurrency payment solution is most profound. Pavo is readily extensible to the entire universe of indoor-grown crops, from cannabis to cucumbers, from strawberries to spinach, from kale to carrots.
